text: I was fearful of falling into a
middle-class marriage at 22 years old
part of me was being drawn to a bohemian
life and I couldn't see melding the two
I was in eighth and Jenny was in seventh
grade we all belong to a temple youth
group and then we kind of paired off
from there we had a depth of intimacy
that is not usual and young people and
in fact we became engaged when I was 22
and Steve was 23 Janie was at Columbia
and he had a good kid and doing what she
was supposed to do and I was driving a
taxicab and being a hippie in the late
60s and we found ourselves going
different ways culturally speaking he
came out of the blue when he said we
have to we have to part and was
devastating I probably put my feelings
for him in a little box and I had no
thought of going back I met someone and
he asked me to marry him so I had three
children all within three and a half
years I didn't know it at the time but
he didn't settle down for another 14 or
15 years mm-hmm
so he truly did need to sow his oats and
throw his hair along and try all
different kinds of things we had a
couple of contacts over the years very
few and then two Springs ago I was
unattached gain was unattached and I
asked her to come out to Arizona to
visit thank you
the first three days that we spent
together it was one conversation after
another the walls came down and we
realized that we were more than friends
this was my ring when I was 22 but this
belonged to Steve's mother and she gave
it to Steve to give to me as an
engagement room after the engagement
broke up
Janie gave me the ring
and I kept it in a safety deposit box
for my whole life and when Jane and I
had rapprochement I took her to the
vault where the ring was kept and it
just flew out of the safety deposit box
right onto her finger and made the deal
again for real this time
with no trepidation and go back in the
out so it was quite a magic moment there
at the bank and opening up the
safe-deposit box there's not significant
regret because we both had interesting
experiences and I'm not sure we would
have been ready to have the kind of
maturity and incredible relationship
that we have now I have the wonderful
chance to go ahead and really complete
the circle that was started many years
ago our time wasn't in 68 but our time
is now
Oh
